EFL SHORT WAIT Chelsea boss Antonio Conte blocks contract negotiations for stars like Eden Hazard and Thibaut Courtois until Blues have secured Premier League title 
Italian wants no distractions as his side closes in on reclaiming their top-flight crown By Wally Downes Jr 31st March 2017, 9:03 am Updated: 31st March 2017, 9:30 am Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ANTONIO CONTE has banned any talk of new contracts for himself and his players as the no-nonsense Italian focuses only on winning the Premier League title. 
Star men like Diego Costa, Eden Hazard and Thibaut Courtois are all wanted by La Liga sides but the Times has revealed no one is signing anything until their name is on the trophy. Getty Images 4 Chelsea bosses have taken Antonio Conte’s advice and canned contract talks for now 
The Blues are cruising to the top-tier title with no European commitments and a place in the FA Cup semi-finals. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Chelsea news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary. Chelsea defender David Luiz schools team mate Willian in the art of free-kick during training 
There is also speculation they could rob Arsenal of star man Alexis Sanchez in the summer and add even more energy and class to their squad. 
From the outside it would appear that now is the ideal time to tie down the two Belgian Real Madrid targets and China favourite Costa. 
But Conte has told his bosses at Stamford Bridge to put the offers on the back burner until the season is over or his side are officially named champions. Blues bosses have complied with Conte’s demands, understandably after he turned Jose Mourinho’s chumps back into champs. 
And on current form they could get the chequebook out and start agreeing deals with their top assets next month. 
Chelsea have a ten-point lead on Tottenham and if they win a few more games, while the chasing pack drop points, they could start the celebrations early. Reuters Conte is guiding his side to a comfortable Premier League title win Wednesday Premier League match preview as Chelsea prepare to take on Man City 
Once the Premier League crown is in the bag, captain John Terry could get some first-team action as he looks set to leave the club after being replaced by a younger back-three. 
And young midfielder Ruben Loftus-Cheek could be handed the two more league appearances he needs to qualify for a title winner's medal.
